name: ToggleButton
description: The ToggleButton component should be used to toggle on or off a limited number of choices.

props.name: value
props.doc: Defines the pre-selected ToggleButton button. The value has to match the one provided in the ToggleButton button. Use a string value.

props.name: text
props.doc: The text shown in the ToggleButton.

props.name: checked
props.doc: Determine whether the ToggleButton is checked or not. The default will be `false`.

props.name: title
props.doc: The `title` of group, describing it a bit further for accessibility reasons.

props.name: label
props.doc: Use either the `label` property or provide a custom one.

props.name: icon
props.doc: Icon to be included in the toggle button.

props.name: icon_position
props.doc: Position of the icon inside the toggle button. Set to `left` or `right`. Defaults to `right` if not set.

props.name: icon_size
props.doc: Define icon width and height. Defaults to `16px`.

props.name: tooltip
props.doc: Provide a string or a React Element to be shown as the tooltip content.

props.name: size
props.doc: The size of the button. For now there is `small`, `medium`, `default` and `large`.

props.name: status
props.doc: Uses the `form-status` component to show failure messages.

props.name: status_state
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. Currently, there are two statuses `[error, info]`. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: status_props
props.doc: Use an object to define additional FormStatus properties.

props.name: globalStatus
props.doc: The [configuration](/uilib/components/global-status/properties/#configuration-object) used for the target [GlobalStatus](/uilib/components/global-status).

props.name: suffix
props.doc: Text describing the content of the ToggleButtonGroup more than the label. You can also send in a React component, so it gets wrapped inside the ToggleButtonGroup component.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: values
props.doc: Defines the pre-selected ToggleButton buttons in `multiselect` mode. The values have to match the one provided in the ToggleButton buttons. Use array, either as JS or JSON string.

props.name: multiselect
props.doc: Defines if the ToggleButton's should act as a multi-selectable list of toggle buttons. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: layout_direction
props.doc: Define the layout direction of the ToggleButton buttons. Can be either `column` or `row`. Defaults to `column`.

props.name: label_direction
props.doc: To define the `label` layout direction on how the next element should be placed on. Can be either `vertical` or `horizontal`. Defaults to `horizontal`.

props.name: label_sr_only
props.doc: Use `true` to make the label only readable by screen readers.

props.name: vertical
props.doc: Will force both `direction` and `label_direction` to be **vertical** if set to `true`.

events.name: on_change
events.doc:
will be called once a ToggleButton button changes the state. Returns an object `{ value, values, event }`.

**NB**: `values` is only available if `multiselect` is used / true.
